title: Study Says A-Plant's Handling of Waste Left Costly Mess
description: The sloppy handling of highly radioactive wastes at a nuclear plant near Oswego, N.Y., on the shore of Lake Ontario, has created a multimillion-dollar mess in its sub-basement, according to a study by a consultant critical of radioactive-waste disposal plans, and largely confirmed by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.

title: Review/Theater;   Simulation Of an Artist In Love With Words
description: On stage in his one-man show, ''Dylan Thomas: Return Journey,'' Bob Kingdom has the look of his subject - short, portly, with a curled lower lip and the general appearance of a fallen cherub. As he begins his performance at the Hudson Guild Theater, the actor also reveals a measure of the disarming Thomas manner. He makes fun of himself while never forgetting that he is, first of all, an artist in love with words.

title: Russ Berrie reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Overseas Shipholding Group reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included net gain of $1,294,000, or 4 cents a share, from disposal of vessels, for the latest year; the 1988 results included gain of $2,190,000, or 6 cents a share, from disposal of vessels, including a fourth quarter net gain of $516,000, or 1 cent a share. Provisions for income taxes in 1989 were $22,201,000 for the year and $4,850,000 for the fourth quarter. In 1988, provisions for income taxes were $16.3 million for the year, and $4.9 million for the fourth quarter. The year-ago periods' share earnings and shares outstanding showed effect of 7-for-5 stock split declared Feb. 7, 1989.

title: Upheaval in the East;   Soviet Party Appealing for Calm As Anxiety Mounts Over Rallies
description: The Communist Party today issued an emotional appeal for calm, amid growing anxiety over nationwide demonstrations scheduled for Sunday.

title: Blyth Holdings reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
At Disney, Still One Elusive Goal
description: Having expanded its theme parks and built a successful movie studio, the Walt Disney Company is turning its attention to one major area where it stills lags behind its competitors: making network television shows.

title: Honda vs. Subaru
description: The Honda Motor Company, which makes the Acura Legend car, said it was seeking to block a trademark for the name of a Subaru car, the Legacy. Honda, which filed a complaint with the United States Patent and Trademark Office, said that it was not challenging use of the Legacy name, but that it did not want a trademark granted for the Legacy. Subaru of America Inc. said an application for the Legacy trademark was filed with the patent office last July by its parent, Fuji Heavy Industries.

title: First Marathon Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Topics of The Times;   Mock Spring, Gentle Winter
description: Spring of a sort has burst into the Bronx. Under the glass roofs of the Enid Haupt Conservatory at the Botanical Gardens, clumps of crimson tulips sway in the indoor breezes, stiff hyacinths give off their soft perfumes and golden narcissus hang over a little pond looking down - as the first Narcissus did - at their own reflections in the water.

title: Pretoria Asserts Its Views Gain Support
description: President F. W. de Klerk said today that the South African Government was approaching its first formal talks with the African National Congress with confidence that Pretoria was gaining international support because of the ''archaic policies'' espoused by Nelson Mandela and other congress leaders.

title: Upheaval in the East: Armies;   WIDER TROOP LIMIT SOUGHT BY SOVIETS
description: In a move that may complicate the conventional arms talks, the Soviet Union suggested today that NATO and the Warsaw Pact cut their troops in Central Europe to between 700,000 and 750,000 each.

title: Restaurants
description: After four recent visits to La Cote Basque, still one of New York City's most sumptuous dining spots, I came away with several lingering memories. One is of an awestruck young couple (my guess was high school prom age) trying to act so worldly as they struggled with the all-French menu and puzzled over the surfeit of silverware. It was one of those terrifyingly wonderful evenings they surely will never forget. Another is the timeless charm of the dining room with its seaside murals, red leather banquettes and profusion of fresh flowers. A third is a splendid bottle of Meursault enjoyed one evening.

title: 20th Century Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a pretax realized investment loss of 2 cents, compared with a realized investment loss of 7 cents for the quarter in 1988. c-Included pretax realized investment gains of 6 cents for the 12 months of 1989 and 15 cents for 1988.

title: Officer Opens Testimony In '86 Brutality Lawsuit
description: It was just moments before midnight and the headlights of the oncoming car moved slowly but dangerously, right at them, an eery warning that something was not right, Gerard Papa and James Rampersant Jr. said. That is how the incident began.

title: Pacific Bancorp reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: The latest year results included credits from tax loss carryforwards of 22 cents a share, compared with 31 cents a share in 1988.

title: KEY RATES
Upheaval in the East: Soviet Union;   Lithuanians Unruffled as First Free Election Nears
description: On Saturday this Baltic republic is to undertake the closest thing to free elections that the Soviet Union has seen since 1917.

title: Lawyer for Suspect Doubts An Arrest in Bomb Slaying
description: Two days after law-enforcement officials identified a Nassau County police officer as a prime suspect in the fatal car-bombing of a Suffolk County narcotics detective last week, investigators today continued seeking evidence to prove their suspicions.

title: East Germans Deny a Report That Ex-Spymaster Has Fled
description: East German officials today disputed a report that the country's former spymaster, Markus Wolf, fled East Germany for the Soviet Union, saying he was only on vacation and was not under investigation for illegal arms deals.

title: Diner's Journal
description: California French

title: BRIEFS
description: * Country Lake Foods Inc., St. Paul, said it was delaying its acquisition of Superior-Dairy Fresh Milk Co., Minneapolis, because the U.S. Department of Justice had raised questions about possible antitrust violations.

title: Allan G. Gruchy, 83, Professor of Economics
description: Dr. Allan Garfield Gruchy, professor of economics at the University of Maryland for 50 years, died of cancer Monday at Washington Adventist Hospital. He was 83 years old and lived in College Park, Md.

title: IPL Systems reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Review/Music;   From Tapping All the Way to Pounding
description: As music listening and performing have moved from the religious to the secular, the rituals surrounding the practice of music have grown increasingly distant from their roots in momentous ceremonies based on life and death or the changing seasons. It is that seriousness, that sense of organic connection with ancient ritual, that Kodo, the group of Japanese percussionists who played at City Center on Tuesday night, tried to convey. And like a whole host of contemporary ritualizers - from American drum groups trying to reproduce African tribal music to heavy metal groups weighted down by occult symbolism - the results mean nothing literally but suggest something approaching the spiritual.

title: Washington Bancorp-N.J.  reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Review/Film;   A Queen-Sized Material Girl Loose at the Mall
description: Rosalie Greenspace (Marianne Sagebrecht) is a queen-sized woman with a heart to match, and she can't help being generous to a fault. Each of the important people in Rosalie's life seems to need something, something that person can sometimes describe right down to the brand name and list price and serial number. It just so happens that Rosalie keeps a secret stash of bad credit cards and bouncing checks, toying with these things in the privacy of her bedroom as if they were illicitly satisfying -as indeed they are. Using these hidden resources, she does her best to supply the computer, the crop-duster or the 16 1/2-pound catfish that would warm some family member's heart.

title: Inter Federal Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After extraordinary tax loss carryforwards of $205,566, or 20 cents a share, for the quarter and $648,028, or 63 cents a share, for the year. c-After extraordinary tax loss carryforwards of $199,976, or 19 cents a share, for the quarter and $908,600, or 88 cents a share, for the year.

description: The tables listing trading in Treasury bills, bonds and notes on page D12 and in Government agency bonds on page D15 do not contain a column listing the change in the bid price from the previous day.

Review/Art;   The Show at the Armory: Dealers' Days in the Sun
description: The 1990 Art Show is slightly larger than the inaugural one last year, the quality of the art is even higher, and there is just as much of an opportunity for the kind of unexpected juxtaposition and chance encounter that can make an art fair something of a Surrealist occasion.

description: b-Included a loss from discontinued operations of $698,000 from the share of losses in Southam Inc.'s discontinued operations and an extraordinary credit of $599,000, or 1 cent a share. c-Included a loss from discontinued operations of $568,000 from the share of losses in Southam Inc.'s discontinued operations and an extraordinary credit of $29,390,000, or 73 cents a share, which includes Torstar's $20 million share of Southam Inc.'s gain from the sale of Selkirk Communications. Results are in Canadian funds.

title: Outdoors;   All Aboard! Skiers Chug to the Hills
description: EARLY on a Saturday morning in 1935, Grand Central Station was crowded with 447 skiers preparing to board a train to Pittsfield, Mass., to test their skills on a hilly pasture in the Berkshires. At the Art Deco station in Pittsfield, the eager skiers clamored out of the train as the thousands of locals who had gathered for the occasion watched.

title: 7 Copters Face Off in Medfly Dispute
description: A raging dispute over pesticide safety took to the skies early today when a Pasadena police helicopter intercepted a phalanx of six helicopters chartered by the state and tried to order them to halt their aerial spraying of the insecticide malathion.

title: Jannock Ltd. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After extraordinary losses of $587,000 for the quarter and $2,074,000 for the year. c-After extraordinary losses of $3,517,000 for the quarter and $3,943,000 for the year. The company is listed on the Toronto and Montreal stock exchanges.

title: Crown Central Petroleum Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Trump Gets Award and Lots of Flashbulbs
description: Donald J. Trump went to lunch with 750 people yesterday, and for 90 golden minutes there was no mention of Marla Maples, hideaway hotel suites, mystery marriages or prenuptial agreements. Well, almost no mention. It was pretty much like old times, the way things were in the days before Mr. Trump's separation from Ivana Trump became daily fare in end-of-the-world-size newspaper headlines and on-the-scene television reports.

title: Dorothy Avery Slesinger, Camp Founder, 91
description: Dorothy Avery Slesinger, a teacher and co-founder of one of the first coeducational summer camps on the East Coast, died of pneumonia on Saturday at New York Hospital. She was 91 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Frank Ross, 85; Producer of Films Made 'The Robe'
description: Frank Ross, a film producer whose credits included ''Of Mice and Men'' and the first wide-screen movie, ''The Robe,'' died of complications after brain surgery on Sunday at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles. He was 85 years old. ''The Robe,'' a biblical epic that took Mr. Ross 10 years to bring to the screen, had its premiere in 1953 and was the first film produced by the Cinemascope process.

title: Wall Street Heads For Darker Days
description: LEAD: The demise of Drexel Burnham Lambert Inc. has been portrayed as the end of an era, and in many ways it is. But it also marks the beginning of a new, darker era in which Wall Street and the nation will pay a heavy price for the excesses of the last decade.

title: Peoples Fedl Savings-DeKalb reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Great American Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included provisions for loan and foreclosure reserves of $87 million for the quarter and provisions for the year totaling $221 million. c-Net income

title: First Federal Capital reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Reflected the operation of the company on a pooling-of-interests basis; First Federal Capital was formed in October 1989 as the holding company of the operations of First Federal Savings and Loan, La Crosse, and First Federal Savings, Madison, which were merged in June. The company said latest year figures included $1,171,000 of expenses related to the merger, and reflected an $831,000 increase in the level of loan loss provisions made in the year over 1988's level.

title: Details' Editor Is Dismissed by Newhouse
description: When Annie Flanders found out two years ago that S. I. Newhouse was buying the magazine that she had founded, she marched in and informed him that she had been fired from every job she had ever had. This week, Ms. Flanders, editor in chief and founder of the offbeat fashion magazine Details, was dismissed again. This time by Mr. Newhouse.

title: Allen Group reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a gain from disposal of discontinued operations of $8,855,000, or $1.08 a share. c-After a loss of $667,000 for the quarter and income of $685,000, or 8 cents a share for the year, both from discontinued operations, and the year also included a gain from disposal of discontinued operations of $1,636,000, or 8 cents a share.

title: Soviet Jews, Arab Fears and Israel
description: Arguably the most important goal for Israel today, and one shared by Americans, is the prompt resettlement of as many Soviet Jews as possible in Israel. Such resettlement provides succor for Soviet Jews, who fear rising anti-Semitism. It advances U.S. interests in seeing those refugees find freedom. It rekindles Israel's founding spirit. What's standing in the way? Arab countries have pressured Moscow to prohibit direct flights between the Soviet Union and Israel. That will cut the expected flow of emigrants by half, to under 50,000 this year.

title: Death of Girl, 2, a Homicide
description: The death of a 2-year-old girl whose disappearance prompted a lengthy manhunt appears to have been a homicide, according to a preliminary autopsy released today. The body of the girl, Aliza Bush, was found last week after her mother, Christine Lane, who had reported the toddler missing, confessed to the police that she had found Aliza dead in her crib on Feb. 2. She said she hid the body because she was afraid no one would believe her. Ms. Lane, 24, of Lansing, was charged with falsely reporting an incident and obstructing justice. No additional charges have been filed against Ms. Lane.

title: AT THE MOVIES
description: Being Richard Burton

title: Caller ID Won't Screen the Pesky Sales Pitch;   Early Warning
description: To the Editor:

title: Notebook;   Red Ransom's Return Overshadows Donn
description: The Donn Handicap at Gulfstream Park on Saturday is the season's first Grade I race outside California, but not the most compelling race on the card. More excitement surrounds the fifth race, a $24,000 seven-furlong allowance event marking the return of Red Ransom.

title: Experiment Puts Wilson on 3d Line
description: The numbers of the line combination due on the ice next were called out quickly and deciphered instantly by Carey Wilson as he sat on the bench in the second period of the 4-4 draw with the Red Wings here Wednesday night.

title: TV Weekend;   From Dennis Potter, a Tale of Youth and Age
description: The best news this weekend is that it's Dennis Potter time again on a good many public television stations. Mr. Potter, who is English, has acquired international status as a writer with two masterly television productions: ''Pennies From Heaven'' in the late 1970's, and ''The Singing Detective,'' first seen in the United States in 1988. On Sunday at 11 P.M. on Channel 13's ''Channel Crossings'' series, American viewers can savor ''Cream in My Coffee,'' a 90-minute film made in 1980. It seems to have fallen, for no discernible reason, into the cracks between the two elaborate mini-series.

title: Fellowships Help Promote Public-Interest Law
description: As a teen-ager growing up in the shadow of Sing Sing prison, Steven Hawkins visited and befriended the men inside. The experience encouraged him to study law and question how blacks fared in the American legal system.

title: K-Tron International reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 30
Quotation of the Day
description: ''We are being asked to accept a pig in a poke under unreasonably short time constraints, and that pig smells awfully bad.''

title: Unocal Will Pay Millions in Pollution Case
description: The Unocal Corporation agreed today to pay $4.22 million to settle a lawsuit charging the oil company with violating the Clean Water Act at its refinery on San Francisco Bay.

title: Sandwich Co-operative Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Par Pharmaceuticals reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a tax credit of $629,000, or 6 cents a share. c-Net income Latest quarter results were adversely affected by the after-effects of the company's August 1989 voluntary moratorium on shipments of Par's oral solid product line. Year-ago quarter results included a charge against pretax income of $11,596,000 and an equivalent credit to income taxes, both relating to the settlement of certain litigation.

title: U.S. Backs Japan in Europe Auto Debate
description: In a new twist on the international trade scene, the United States trade representative, Carla A. Hills, warned today that Washington would strongly protest any attempt by the European Community to restrict entry into Europe of American-built Japanese cars, a subject of intense current debate in Brussels.

title: Eastern Air In Pact With Its Creditors
description: After nearly a year of negotiations, Eastern Airlines reached an agreement in principle yesterday with its unsecured creditors on a plan to bring the carrier out of bankruptcy within several months.

title: Sony Reports Gain of 44.8%
description: The Sony Corporation said today that its third-quarter profits jumped 44.8 percent on strong sales gains.

description: The company said higher interest expense took a toll on its first-quarter results. Interest expense was $1.5 million higher, primarily due to its August 1989 acquisition of Nichols- Homeshield.

Tickets: $6. Reservations: 666-1716. description: The launching of the space shuttle Atlantis and its secret military cargo was postponed again today until at least Saturday morning.

title: Japan Backs Cheney's Troop-Cut Plan
description: Nearing the end of his trip to Asia, Secretary of Defense Dick Cheney won general approval from Japan on Thursday for a proposal to reduce American forces in East Asia and the Pacific by 10 percent, including a 5,000 to 6,000 cut in troops stationed here.

title: Belvedere Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income The company said its fourth quarter 1989 revenues suffered due to decreased revenues of its former Bermuda units, which were sold in a transaction closing Dec. 14, 1989. The sale of the Bermuda units generated a net loss of $5,109,000. The company also said fourth quarter earnings were impacted by the California earthquake, an explosion at a Texas petrochemical plant and freezing weather in late December.

title: Lincoln Foodservice Products Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income The company said fourth-quarter results benefited from a change in the method for valuing inventories. If this new method had been used in 1988, net income for the 1988 fourth quarter would have been lower by $352,000, or 11 cents a share. The change does not affect the results for the full year 1988.

title: Grand Prix Indoor Circuit Goes Down to the Finish
description: Another North American indoor track and field Grand Prix season closes tonight with the USA/Mobil championships in Madison Square Garden, and by most accounts the season has been rather devoid of excitement.

title: Article 372790 -- No Title
description: Ford Holdings Inc. yesterday priced a two-part financing totaling $1 billion through underwriters led by Goldman, Sachs & Company.

description: To the Editor:

title: Eastman Kodak
description: The Eastman Kodak Company introduced an electronic film-editing system that is intended to take the place of the razor blade in professional photography labs. The system is the company's latest entry in the developing field of hybrid electronic photography. The Premier image enhancement system begins and ends with a regular film image. In between, images can be electronically retouched, cropped, merged into a composite, or have their color, balance and contrast changed.

title: Media General Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included income of $9.9 million relating to company's equity in a gain from the sale of a newspaper by Garden State Newspapers; a special charge of $6.5 million involving the writeoff of unrecovered costs and expenses relating to a lawsuit; and additional charges reflecting the writeoff of certain discontinued printing equipment, revisions to certain estimated liabilities and reserves and revisions to the estimated effective income tax rate used throughout the year, which reduced net income by about $9.5 million, for quarter and year. c-Included $41.5 million charge relating principally to the broadcast segment for both periods. The latest year's net income also included gain of $5.7 million, or 22 cents a share, from sale of Newsprint Mill. Revenue in year-ago periods included $33 million from discontinued operations for the quarter and $137 million for the year.

title: Amity Bancorp Inc.  reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Review/Film;   Crazy Quilt Of Family, Shakespeare And Farce
description: Failure has its gradations, just as success does. There are films that fail at doing nothing more elaborate than occupying their viewers' attention for an hour or two, and there are others that fail on a much higher plane. John Boorman's ''Where the Heart Is,'' incorporating elements of Shakespeare, Impressionist painting, magic, fashion and family psychology into a wildly imaginative, thoroughly incoherent mix, has an undeniable grandeur and nobility even in the midst of its broadest lapses of sense, taste and style. It is indeed a majestic dud.

title: New York Can't Go It Alone in the Fight to Control Acid Rain
description: To the Editor:

title: Conseco Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Nonqualifiers Sought
description: A study by the National Collegiate Athletic Association shows that a growing percentage of athletic scholarships from Division I schools is going to athletes who do not meet academic standards for first-year eligibility under Proposition 48.

title: Douglas Makes Deal for Two Fights
description: James (Buster) Douglas would make $25 million to fight Evander Holyfield and could get $35 million for a rematch with Mike Tyson under a deal with Steve Wynn, the promoter Bob Arum said today.

title: Victor Lasky, 72, Whose Writings Focused on Fighting Communists
description: Victor Lasky, a columnist and author whose outspoken anti-Communist views were the main focus of his writing and lecturing, died of abdominal cancer yesterday at Georgetown University Hospital in Washington. He was 72 years old and lived in Washington.

title: A Bolshevik 'Majority'
description: To the Editor:

title: Cabano Expeditex reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 6
description: b-Net loss Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Nearly 2 Years Later, Pennzoil Fills Position
description: The Pennzoil Company yesterday named James L. Pate its chief operating officer, filling a vacant post in its top management.

title: Late Selloff Pushes Dow 8.79 Points Lower
description: Stocks fell broadly yesterday, depressed by late selling, and after being nearly 30 points higher than its opening level about 2 P.M., the Dow Jones industrial average finished 8.79 points lower, at 2,574.77.

title: Browns Add More Jets
description: The Cleveland Browns' coaching staff is beginning to look like the Jets' staff, circa 1988. Mike Faulkiner, who had been the Jets' defensive backs coach, yesterday became the fifth former assistant from the Jets to join the Browns. He will assist Bud Carson, the head coach, in several areas.

title: Move by Binks
description: Illinois Tool Works Inc. said the board of Binks Manufacturing Company will meet this weekend to consider a $132.3 million offer by the Ransburg Corporation, an Illinois Tool subsidiary. On Tuesday, Ransburg offered $45 a share in cash or a combination of cash and stock for Binks. Ransburg's chairman, John D. Nichols, said his company's representatives would be available to meet with representatives of Binks.

title: Bass Group Cuts Its Enterra Stake
description: An investment group led by members of the Bass family of Fort Worth has lowered its stake in the Enterra Corporation to 3.2 percent from 7.2 percent. In its filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the Bass group gave no reason for the sale of the shares. The group had acquired its Enterra shares in exchange for its holdings in CRC Evans Pipeline International Inc., which merged with the Houston-based energy-services company in February 1988.

title: Federal Jurors Rule For Transit officers In Decoy Unit Arrest
description: A Federal civil jury yesterday rejected a man's contention that he had been wrongfully arrested by a transit police decoy unit in a chain snatching in a Brooklyn subway station three years ago. The man was acquitted of the chain-snatching charge.

title: Avalon Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After income from discontinued operations of $35,000 for the quarter and $219,000, or 1 cent a share for the year. c-Net income d-Included income from discontinued operations of $127,000 and $47,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. The latest quarter and year's losses from continuing operations of $10,124,000 and $10,117,000, respectively, both included ''a significant reduction'' of the carrying amount of Poco Petroleums Ltd.'s oil and gas assets. The company said its common equity share of Poco's net loss for 1989 was $14.1 million. The latest year also included $12,200,000 pretax gain on sale of its Canadian oil and gas properties to Poco Petroleums and $6,900,000 in non-recurring transactional expenses as a result of an agreement with a former major shareholder to seek a buyer for the company. Year-ago income from continuing operations of $4,141,000 for the quarter and the year's loss from continuing operations of $421,000 both included $4.550,000 gain on the sale of investments.

title: People
description: * Michael Moore, worldwide media director of D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles, has been appointed a corporate executive vice president.

description: b-Included a tax credit of $178,000 and $1,100,000 for the quarter and year, respectively.

title: SCS Buys Westview
description: Westview Press of Boulder, Colo. a leading publisher of scholarly books, has been acquired by SCS Communications Inc. of New York. Terms of the deal, announced Tuesday, have not been disclosed.

title: Kohlberg Suit Settlement
description: A lawsuit filed by Jerome J. Kohlberg Jr. last August against his two former partners, Henry R. Kravis and George R. Roberts, was settled earlier this month, according to a filing in New York State Supreme Court.

title: Auctions
description: Boldini and Gerome

title: Pinnacle West Capital reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included losses from discontinued operations $544,240,000 and $675,968,00 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-Included losses from discontinued operations of $124,542,000 and $148,487,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. d-Net income

title: Abington Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income The bank said its latest fourth quarter and full year results reflected the writedown of real estate assets of $739,000 and $1,054,000, respectively.

title: A Bronx 13-Year-Old Is Shot While Going to Buy Cereal
description: A 13-year-old boy who had crossed a street near his home to buy cereal and milk was shot and seriously wounded Wednesday night when he walked into the crossfire between suspected drug dealers in the Bronx, the police said.

title: Chronicle
description: CARLY SIMON added a Grammy Award to her Oscar and Golden Globe Award for her song ''Let the River Run,'' from the movie ''Working Girl.'' The song, she said, was ''an anthem for New York.'' It is played as the movie starts, with a scene of office workers traveling to Manhattan on the Staten Island ferry.

title: International Proteins Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Publishers In Mission To Moscow
description: An increasing number of American magazine publishers and advertisers are zeroing in on a relatively untapped target market: the Soviet Union.

title: Labor Party in Israel Gives Likud Deadline on Bid for Meeting Arabs
description: The Labor Party voted today to give Prime Minister Yitzhak Shamir and his Likud Party two weeks to accept Labor's compromise formula for starting negotiations between Israel and the Palestinians, or face dissolution of the Government.

title: Goodyear Canada reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income The company said latest fourth- quarter results were affected by a $9.1 millin before-tax charge for restructuring of subsidiary operations. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Wolves Trade Johnson
description: Steve Johnson, who feuded with Minnesota from the time he was picked by the Timberwolves in the expansion draft, was traded last night to Seattle for Brad Sellers.

title: Bizmart Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 27
description: b-Net loss

title: Toro Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 2
Topics of The Times;   A Warm and Gentle Bishop
description: For 22 years Francis J. Mugavero, the departing Bishop of Brooklyn, has graced the 1.6 million Roman Catholics of his diocese with warm, gentle leadership. Now 75 and about to retire, he leaves a proud legacy, more compassionate and charitable than political.

title: Cabaret to a Different Drummer
description: WHEN Michael Moriarty takes the stage of the Ballroom to perform his new nightclub act, one of the first things he does is explain that his show is ''jazz cabaret,'' not cabaret per se. The actor and singer's disclaimer prefaces a quirky, fascinating show that breaks down the distinctions between music-making and acting. Midway in a program that mixes jazz standards and original songs, he suspends the music altogether to deliver a monologue from his new one-man play, ''A Special Providence.'' One leaves the Ballroom having been shown an unusual portrait of the actor as musician.

title: Inquiry Into Senator's Financial Affairs Advances
description: The Senate Ethics Committee said today that there was ''substantial credible evidence'' that Senator Dave Durenberger, a Minnesota Republican, might have violated Senate rules in connection with a book publishing deal and use of a limousine for personal travel.

title: New Bet Curb In Las Vegas
description: The Las Vegas City Council has approved an ordinance that would prohibit athletes in the National Collegiate Athletic Association from betting on college games in sports books in Las Vegas, even if the athletes are over age 21.

title: Paulson Group Won't Buy Learjet
description: The group that is acquiring the Gulfstream Aerospace Corporation has let its $60 million agreement to buy the Learjet Corporation expire. Gulfstream said its chairman, Allen E. Paulson, had decided not to acquire Learjet out of concern that the Chapter 11 bankruptcy of the jet maker's parent, Integrated Resources Inc., could lead to a bidding fight.

title: Baldwin & Lyons reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After capital loss of $197,203 for the quarter and capital gain of $1,246,291, or 22 cents a share for the year. c-Included capital gains of $805,119, or 13 cents a share and $1,714,103, or 27 cents a share for the quarter and year, respectively.

title: A Church-State Conflict Arises Over AIDS Care
description: A clash between Roman Catholic officials and New York State over the counseling of AIDS patients is jeopardizing AIDS care at the church's hospitals and nursing homes, which are major providers of such services in New York City, church and state leaders say.

title: Ply Gem Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $5,745,000, or 51 cents a share, which included a $2,786,000, or 25 cents a share, tax benefit from the adoption of SFAS 96 and a $2,959,000, or 26 cents a share, gain from investment transactions.

title: J.M. Smucker reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Fairfield First Bank & Trust reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: All per share earnings were adjusted for a 10 percent stock dividend paid in July 1989.

title: First Low-Calorie Substitute For Fats Is Approved by U.S
description: The Food and Drug Administration approved the first low-calorie substitute for fat yesterday, opening the door for a new class of reduced-fat food products that may revolutionize the American diet.

title: Heritage Entertainment reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
No End in Sight to Filibuster In Senate on Armenian Issue
description: The Senate rejected an effort to cut off debate today on a proposed resolution to commemorate an ''Armenian genocide,'' a step that signals trouble for supporters of the measure.

title: The Reagan Tape;   Reagan as Witness: Friendly but Forgetful
description: Former President Ronald Reagan, sitting upright in a red leather chair in the witness box, smiled a bit, even chuckled, as he answered hundreds of questions last week in his videotaped deposition.

title: Apple Computer Cuts Some Prices
description: Faced with lower-than-expected sales, Apple Computer Inc. lowered prices on several models in the middle of its Macintosh line by 10 to 17 percent. Apple also dropped prices on some Laser Writer printers. The new prices are effective immediately.

title: Brookfield Bancshares reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included $665,000 provision for losses on real estate. c-Net income

title: FINANCE BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: Washington at Work;   Guardian of Baker's Door at State: A Quick Study Who Rose Rapidly
description: When people who have worked with Robert B. Zoellick are asked to talk about him, they sound a little like the brainwashed servicemen in ''The Manchurian Candidate,'' who uniformly refer to their sergeant as ''the kindest, bravest, warmest, most wonderful human being I've ever known in my life.''

title: Bank of New England Loss Worse Than Expected in '89
description: The Bank of New England Corporation said today that its 1989 losses of $1.11 billion were worse than expected. It said it was studying whether loan-loss provisions should have been bigger earlier in the year.

title: Review/Art;   Images of Women, Dignified or Not, but Always Nude
description: ''Odalisque,'' a group show of 41 primarily photographic works at the Jayne H. Baum Gallery in SoHo, has its intriguing moments. But it also brings to mind a recent card mailed out by the Conceptual artist and all-around subversive Les Levine urging the abolition of all group shows.

title: Excerpts From Reagan's Testimony on the Iran-Contra Affair
description: Following are excerpts from former President Ronald Reagan's deposition last week in Los Angeles in the trial of Rear Adm. John M. Poindexter, his former national security adviser, on charges relating to the Iran-contra affair. The testimony, as transcribed by the Federal District Court for the District of Columbia, was made public today. Mr. Reagan's lawyer is Theodore B. Olson. Mr. Poindexter's lawyers are Richard W. Beckler, Joseph T. Small Jr., Stephen McNabb and Frederick Robinson. The office of the independent counsel was represented by Dan Webb, Christian J. Mixter, Howard Pearl and Louise Radin.

title: United Dominion Realty reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Shares outstanding represent shares outstanding at the end of the period, not average shares during the period.

title: UAL to Give Unions Data for Possible Bid
description: The UAL Corporation, the parent of United Airlines, said yesterday that its board had authorized the release of financial information to United's unions but that it had not received a new buyout proposal from them.

title: Jets Dispose Of Devils With Ease
description: It became apparent early that the Devils would have another rather unproductive night.

title: Judge Supports Search For Waste Disposal Site
description: A State Supreme Court judge today ordered Allegany County residents to stop interfering with state inspectors who are examining sites for a proposed radioactive waste disposal site.

title: Georgia Tech Stunned
description: Bryant Stith's short jumper in the lane at the buzzer gave Virginia a 73-71 upset victory over No. 8 Georgia Tech tonight and ended the Yellow Jackets' seven-game winning streak.

title: Review/Film;   Clashing Gladiators in the Bloody Sport of a Future Dark Age
description: David Peoples's ''Blood of Heroes,'' made by an American company in Australia, is an unusually successful film of its kind, a good, lean variation on the post-apocalypse adventure-thriller that looks into the future to see the Dark Ages of the past.

title: The Power of Truth
description: The idea of human rights is a powerful element in these extraordinary times. Not so long ago, it was dismissed by the practitioners of realpolitik as too lofty to matter. Now we know that the demand for human rights can move the most frozen political systems.

title: Expert Testifies Study Guarded Prego's Identity
description: An expert on medical ethics testified yesterday that Dr. Veronica Prego's confidentiality had been properly safeguarded in an AIDS research study.

title: Constitution Bancorp of New England reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income The bank's loan loss provision for the latest fourth quarter was $2,589,000, compared with $67,000 for year-ago period.

title: Upheaval in the East: Czechoslovakia;   Havel Takes Manhattan, An Isle of Luncheons
description: Vaclav Havel, the playwright-President of Czechoslovakia, whirled through a tour of New York City yesterday that began with breakfast at Gracie Mansion, moved on to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the residence of the city's Cardinal, the United Nations, Columbia University, and culminated in a gala concert at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine. And that was all before dinner.

title:
LAW;

Don't Bite the Lawyers
description: LEAD: Following hard on last year's proliferation of lawyer jokes, 1990 is not shaping up as a good year for lawyers.

title: Instron Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Lawyers Charge Officials' Leaks Set Up Helmsley
description: Lawyers for Leona Helmsley charged yesterday that Federal prosecutors ''deliberately leaked'' testimony she gave under immunity in 1985 in a sales-tax-fraud investigation so that they could later gain the Federal and state indictments filed against her for income-tax fraud.

title: At the Bar
description: Is there a constitutionally protected right to flog a dead horse? How about a live one? Do the owners of the late great Secretariat have the same rights as the heirs of Babe Ruth? Are Roy Rogers and Trigger or Christie Brinkley and Easy Goer equal under the law? They are questions that have horse owners, horse artists and at least a few horse lawyers talking.

title: Jamaica to FCB/Leber
description: The Jamaica Tourist Board awarded its advertising account yesterday to FCB/Leber Katz Partners. The previous agency, Young & Rubicam, lost the account when the United States Government charged it with conspiring to bribe Jamaican officials to win the account, which bills about $6 million. Young & Rubicam has pleaded guilty to one count of conspiring to bribe officials. The award enables FCB/Leber Katz to return to island advertising; last year it lost Bermuda's account, which it had held for 17 years, to DDB Needham.

title: Nepal and India Move Close to Ending Dispute
description: After a bitter yearlong standoff, India and Nepal appeared today to have agreed on a formula for settling their trade and transit disputes.

title: Upheaval in the East: Germanys;   East German Social Democrats Meet to Pick a Front-Runner
description: The Social Democrats met today in this city, where the peaceful revolution that overthrew the Communist Government last fall stirred most strongly, to choose their candidate for Prime Minister in elections that are only 24 days off.

title: Centercore reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss c-After losses from discontinued operations of $219,700 and $416,000 for the quarter and year, respectively, and an extraordinary charge of $335,000 for both the quarter and year, which reflects 1988 loss from disposal of discontinued operations.

title: Ewing Hits Another 41 As Knicks Defeat Bullets
description: After the Knicks beat the Washington Bullets, 119-110, here tonight at the Capital Centre, someone pointed out to Patrick Ewing that he had scored 41 points for the second successive game.

title: La Quinta Motor Inns Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The year results consisted of only 7 months because the company changed to a calendar year from a fiscal year ended May 31.

title: Mutual Federal Savings reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included extraordinary tax loss carryforwards of $76,000 and after a loss of $20.3 million from an adjustment in accounting. c-Net income and after an extraordinary tax loss carryforward of $155,000.

title: North American Savings reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company said per share earnings were adjusted for the newly issued stock and the 10 percent stock dividend paid in September 1989.

title: Big Funds Pressing for Voice In Management of Companies
description: Many investment managers, who oversee funds with billions of dollars of company shares, want more of a say in how American corporations are run. And more of them are starting to use their financial muscle to try to obtain it.

title: Market Place;   Computer Seller Defies a Slump
description: WHILE much of the personal computer retailing industry is in a slump, one company appears to be sailing along, reporting sharply higher profits as it expands at a feverish pace.

title: VS Services reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 27
description: Figures are in Canadian funds.

title: Delta Natural Gas Co.  reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: FRIDAY

title: The Reagan Tape;   REAGAN TESTIFIES HE DID NOT ORDER ANY ILLEGAL ACTS
description: In a videotaped deposition made public today, former President Ronald Reagan repeatedly denied that he ever instructed his subordinates to violate the law during the Iran-contra affair. Mr. Reagan said he never knew about the full extent of his aides' involvement in covert efforts to help the Nicaraguan rebels.

title: Monsanto Shares Up Sharply On Hopes for Fat Substitute
description: Even though frozen desserts made with Nutrasweet's new fat substitute will be in grocers' freezers this summer, the Monsanto Company subsidiary is unlikely to find itself gorging on profits for years.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-9

title: Collins Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Included extraordinary tax credits of $106,000, or 3 cents a share for the latest quarter and $77,000, or 2 cents a share for the year-earlier period.

title: Lost In The U.S.A.
description: LEAD: Imagine you're somewhere near the John Hancock Building in downtown Boston when the urge hits you to see the Central Park Zoo in New York City. You've never driven to New York before. Without maps of the interstate highway system and New York City, several stops to ask directions and a lot of luck, what are the chances that you'll find your way?

title: Brown-Forman Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Included an after-tax charge of $59.9 million for carrying value of California Cooler intangible assets and a gain from cumulative effect of an accounting change of $11,526,000. c-Included a gain of $22.3 million from sale of U.S. marketing rights for Martell Cognac for both the quarter and 9 months, and the 9 months also included an after-tax charge of $5.4 million for closing Stockton, Calif., plant. The company said sales excluded federal excise taxes.

title: Centennial Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Converting a Mill;   Condos in 19th-Century Structures
description: In 1844, when Robert Beattie, an Irish immigrant, built a brownstone carpet mill on the banks of the Passaic River in Little Falls, N.J., he brought jobs, the railroad and residents to the tiny community. Now, a century and a half later, Mr. Beattie's mill is stimulating new growth for the town.

title: Tape Obscenity Conviction Is Upset
description: In a case closely watched by music industry officials around the nation, an Alabama Circuit Court today overturned the conviction of a record-store owner for selling a tape of rap music that local officials deemed obscene.

title: Southmark Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Net income and included income from discontinued operations of $4,955,000, or 11 cents a share, and an extraordinary credit from early retirement of debt of $26,436,000, or 58 cents a share.

title: Gleason Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included income of $402,000, or 7 cents a share for the quarter and a loss of $2,096,000 for the year, both from discontinued operations, and the year also included a gain on sale of the company's Power Systems division of $7,725,000, or $1.35 a share. c-Net loss d-After losses from discontinued operations of $324,000 and $5,839,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. Results in the year-ago fourth quarter included an after-tax gain of $2,000,000, or 35 cents a share, on the sale of certain land and buildings. Operating results for both the Gleason Components Group and Gleason Power Systems have been reclassified from amounts previously reported and are presented as discontinued operations.

title: A Sampling of Weekend Black History Events
description: Black History Month is being celebrated with a variety of events around New York City. Here is a sampling of events this weekend.

title: 2 Bronx Men Shot Dead In a Car in Larchmont
description: Two Bronx men were found fatally shot in the front seat of a late model Mercedes Benz on a dead-end street Wednesday, the authorities said today.

title: Home Capital Group reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: The 1988 year restated to reflect the sale of Kingsway General Insurance. Results are in Canadian funds.

title: British Curb On Rate Swaps
description: Britain's Court of Appeal ruled yesterday that interest rate swaps are legal for local government authorities if they are used to limit interest rate risks but not if they are used for speculative trading for profit.

title: Money Fund Assets Up
description: The assets of the nation's 497 money market mutual funds increased by $3.57 billion, to $390.68 billion, for the week ended Wednesday, the Investment Company Institute said yesterday. Those of the 152 institutional funds rose $1.25 billion, to $92.67 billion. The assets of the 244 general-purpose funds rose $1.33 billion, to $132.55 billion. The 101 broker-dealer funds increased $992.2 million, to $165.46 billion, the institute said.

title: Fire Hazard Brings Recall of Spray Confetti
description: The Consumer Product Safety Commission today recalled more than a million cans of spray string confetti because the propellants are flammable.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Aon Corp., Chicago, an insurance holding company, said its chairman, W. Clement Stone, would become chairman emeritus. He will remain chairman of Aon's Combined Insurance Co. of America unit.

title: Economic Scene;   German Options On Money Union
description: CHANCELLOR HELMUT KOHL means to use his country's powerful currency as the catalyst for uniting East and West Germany. A cardinal aim of Mr. Kohl's plan for rapid monetary union is to check the emigration of Eastern workers to the West. Far more than 400,000 East Germans have moved into West Germany, and the exodus is continuing at a rate of about 2,000 a week.

title: George Weston reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $37,400,000 for the latest year from the sale of the White Swan division; the prior year included an extraordinary credit of $53,100,000, or $1.15. Figures are in Canadian funds.

title: Fifth Guilty Plea in a U.S. Housing Inquiry
description: A former executive director of the Perth Amboy Housing Authority pleaded guilty to bribery and tax evasion Wednesday, the fifth person in less than a week to admit guilt in Federal District Court here to corruption involving contracts for federally financed housing.

title: Corrections
description: A front-page article on Feb. 15 about contraceptives misstated the National Right to Life Committee's position on their development. It opposes work that might lead to abortion-inducing drugs, but neither supports nor opposes contraception.

title: Imperial Chemical Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The net income figures are after extraordinary items. The results are in U.S. dollars and at an exchange rate of $1.60 to the pound sterling, the rate prevailing on Dec. 31, 1989. Share earnings represented American Depositary Receipts (ADR) and four ICI ordinary shares are represented by each ADR.

title: Hawthorne Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Whitman Corp. May Sell Unit
description: The Whitman Corporation, the consumer goods and services conglomerate, said it was considering restructuring its operations and selling one of its four main businesses.

title: Sony Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: U.S. dollar amounts have been translated from yen at the rate of 143 yen equaled U.S. $1, the approximate Tokyo foreign exchange market rate as of Dec. 29, 1989. On Nov. 1 and Nov. 7, 1989, the company acquired Columbia Pictures Entertainment Inc. and the Guber- Peters Entertainment Company, which are operating primarily in the film business, for approximately $3.4 billion and $0.2 billion, respectively. The acquisition was accounted for as a purchase and the company's consolidated financial statements include operating results of acquired companies for the period from the date of acquisitions. Share earnings represented American Depositary Share and the sales, net sales.

title: Truth and Millions Elusive on Iran-Contra
description: To the Editor:

title: Upheaval in the East;   Bonn Again Sidesteps Warsaw's Growing Demand for Guarantees on Its Borders
description: A spokesman for Chancellor Helmut Kohl today again dodged Poland's growing demand that West Germany affirm the permanence of the two countries' border. But pressures mounted on Mr. Kohl both at home and abroad to issue the unequivocal guarantee that the Poles are seeking.

title: Caller ID Won't Screen the Pesky Sales Pitch;   Breathers, Beware
description: To the Editor:

title: Marble Is Suspended
description: Roy Marble, a rookie with the Atlanta Hawks, was suspended yesterday by the National Basketball Association for the remainder of the season for violating the league's substance-abuse policy.

title: American Software reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Included an extraordinary credit of $713,000, or 5 cents a share.

title: Players Beat Owners In Arbitration Cases
description: Doug Drabek won his arbitration case against the Pirates yesterday, giving players a final record of 14-10 against the owners this year, their largest margin in 10 years.

title: Cohasset Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income

title: Greenspan Sees End to Price Rises
description: Alan Greenspan, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that the surge in consumer prices last month was an aberration, was unlikely to continue and might already have eased.

title: United Fincl Corp of S.C.  reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Ameriana Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss of $1,689,000 from discontinued operations, which included a loss of $1.1 million from sale of discontinued operations.

title: Howtek Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: La Salle's Simmons Passes 3,000
description: His point total is measured in thousands, although he never scored more than 40 points at a time. He received a proclamation today from Gov. Robert P. Casey declaring that next Tuesday would be Lionel Simmons Day throughout the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania.

title: Tokyo Stock Prices Plunge Again
description: Nervousness over rumors of an interest rate increase and a heavy dose of program selling sent the Tokyo Stock Exchange into its second major fall in a week on Friday, losing 2.5 percent of its value.

title: R-Med International reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
American Republic Banc reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
Saskatchewan Trust reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Included a provision of $1,443,353 following a review of the company's loan portfolio and property held for resale. c-Net income Figures are in Canadian funds.

title: Drexel Creditors to Ask For Details on Bonuses
description: Creditors of the Drexel Burnham Lambert Group plan to file a motion today with the Federal judge overseeing its bankruptcy seeking the appointment of an official to examine Drexel's books.

title: Review/Film;   Two Victorian Eccentrics, Exploring and Feuding
description: Of all the restless, well-born Englishmen who roamed the world throughout the 19th century, poking into darkest continents and leaving a gazeteer of English place names in their wake, Sir Richard Francis Burton (1821-1890) remains one of the most complex and enduringly romantic.

title: Caller ID Won't Screen the Pesky Sales Pitch;   Privacy for Callers
description: To the Editor:

title: Moore-Handley Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After income of $83,000, or 4 cents a share, from an adjustment in accounting.

title: New York State Warned It Faces Even Worse Financial Troubles
description: New York State's financial outlook turned bleaker today when Standard & Poor's warned that the state's credit rating might slip and the Cuomo administration released a report projecting that budget troubles would last at least three more years.

title: Medical Dynamics reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Renault and Volvo Decide to Join Forces
description: Renault, the state-owned automotive group that is France's biggest industrial concern, and Volvo, Sweden's leading industrial company, announced a far-reaching alliance today, under which each will own large shares of the other. The combined group will be the world's largest truck maker and a more powerful competitor in the automobile market.

title: Florio Rebuffs Plan for Toll Increase on the Turnpike
description: Gov. Jim Florio today rejected the New Jersey Turnpike Authority's request for a large toll increase, lambasting the authority for irresponsible management and saying it would have to know what it would do with the money before it asked motorists to pay more.

title: Crownx Inc. reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss and after a loss from discontinued operations of $11,306,000 and an extraordinary charge of $116,798,000. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Aide to Vermont's Governor Resigns Over Lewd Remark
description: Gov. Madeleine M. Kunin's press secretary resigned today for making a lewd comment to a female reporter.

title: Douglas Back in Ring
description: James (Buster) Douglas's first return to the ring since knocking out Mike Tyson for the world heavyweight championship was a ''Main Event'' he won't soon forget.

title: Patents;   Fighting Salmonella With Other Bacteria
description: A scientist at Coors Biotech Inc., a subsidiary of the Adolph Coors Company, the Golden, Colo., brewer, has invented a method of fighting salmonella without antibiotics.

title: CHRONICLE
description: The nation's leading writers threw a final bouquet to their colleague VACLAV HAVEL at the Vivian Beaumont Theater on Thursday night. The informal dinner was his last event for Mr. Havel, the President of Czechoslovakia and a playwright, before his return to Prague after three whirlwind days in Washington and New York.

title: Baker Presses Israel to Open Peace Talks
description: Secretary of State James A. Baker 3d told Foreign Minister Moshe Arens today that it was time for Israel to accept his compromise formula for opening talks between Israelis and Palestinians, Administration officials said.

title: 16-Year Term for Drunken Driver
description: Larry Mahoney was sentenced today to 16 years in prison for causing the deaths of 27 people in a collision between his pickup truck and a school bus carrying a church group, the worst drunken-driving accident in the nation's history.

title: Old World Faces in the New
description: For more than three months now, television screens have been filled with faces Americans rarely saw before, those of ordinary Czechoslovaks, East Germans, Hungarians, Bulgarians and the citizens of half a dozen Soviet republics. As these peoples emerge from the gloom of official obscurity, Americans feel a jolt of recognition: they look remarkably like people we know.

title: 3d Delay in Shuttle Launching
description: Officials at the Kennedy Space Center said today that they were cautiously optimistic about launching the space shuttle Atlantis and its secret payload early Sunday. They said they expected a break in the bad weather that has been mainly responsible for delaying the craft's military mission.

title: Hooper Holmes reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a one-time pre-tax expense provision of $575,000 relative to the sale of Business Information Services in 1988 and a reduction of same of $305,000 in 1989. Year-ago results included $8.6 million of revenue and $2.55 million, or 83 cents a share, of net income associated with 1988 sale of Business Information Services operations. The company said its earnings rose 17 percent in 1989 when a $2.6 million gain on the 1988 sale of Business Information Services was excluded.

title: India Crash Revives French Dispute Over Safety of Airbus Jet
description: The crash of an Airbus A320 jet that killed 97 people in India last week has reignited a dispute in France over whether the computerized, highly advanced aircraft is too complicated to fly. The French pilots union is urging that the airliner be grounded in France.

title: NMR of America reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings for the latest quarter included income tax benefit from operating loss carryforward of 4 cents a share, compared with a benefit of 3 cents a share, for year-ago period. Latest 9 months' share earnings included income tax benefit of 10 cents a share, compared with a benefit of 9 cents a share, for year-ago period. The 1988 earnings have been restated to conform to 1989 presentation. The 9 months' results in 1988 included the company's former Syracuse, N.Y. Magnetic Resonance Imaging Center, which was sold in December 1988. NMR said the 1988 figures benefited from gains on the sales of the Syracuse site and interests in a limited partnership.

title: Maine Public Service Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Mercantile Library Is Circulating Again
description: To the Editor:

title: Ernst Drops Pepsi for Coke As Auditor
description: A Coke executive, Carlton L. Curtis, disputed Pepsi's account. ''That was an Ernst & Young decision,'' he said. Mort Meyerson, a spokesman for the accounting firm, said, ''We have made a decision to make a choice between two valued clients because we understood the Coca-Cola Company's concerns.'' The auditor change was disclosed yesterday in documents that Pepsico filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Derlan Industries reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss of $5.7 million on discontinuing operations of Tymac Controls Corp. and a gain of $1.4 million on sale of Brite-Vue Glass Systems Inc. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Pratt & Lambert Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included after-tax gain on the sale of property of $285,000, or 5 cents a share. Corrected from yesterday's editions.

title: Law Gets No Respect at Legal Services
description: To the Editor:

title: Litton Contract
description: Litton Industries said it had won a $614.2 million Navy contract to build three Aegis guided-missile destroyers. Litton's Ingalls Shipbuilding division in Pascagoula, Miss., already holds a contract to build three of the ships. In addition to the six Aegis destroyers, Ingalls is building seven Ticonderoga-class Aegis guided-missile cruisers and three more Wasp-class amphibious assault ships.

title: Bridge
description: A team representing corporate America played two short matches in London yesterday afternoon against representatives of the British Parliament, and narrowly escaped a double defeat.

title: Softsel Computer Products reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Synalloy Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After extraordinary credits of $178,000, or 5 cents a share, for the quarter and $1.1 million, or 29 cents a share, for the year.

title: Private-School Question Causes Embarrassment
description: The New York City Schools Chancellor, Joseph A. Fernandez, was forced to address a question yesterday that struck very close to home.

title: Enviropact reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included losses from discontinued operations of $251,000 and $1,652,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. c-After income from discontinued operations of $20,000 for the quarter and $633,000 for the 6 months, and the 6 months also included an extraordinary charge from early extinguishment of debt of $324,000. Latest 6-month loss from continuing operations included losses of $13,000 in the quarter and $1,318,000 in the 6 months in 1989 compared to a gain of $623,000 in the 6 months of 1988 on sale of discontinued operations. Year-ago results are restated.

title: Commonwealth Edison Co.  reports earnings for 12mo Jan 31
For Liberia's Army, the Spoils Include the People's Hatred
description: Sakou Saysay has had enough and wants to leave. The only obstacle now is finding a wagon big enough to take his 3 wives and 18 children.

title: About New York;   Passing the Word To the Children Of the Hotels
description: Someday, the fact that New York families without homes were placed by their government in dilapidated hotels may be perceived as an odd footnote to history. Nearly two-thirds of families living in them have already left.

title: Counsel Corp. reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Included extraordinary credits of $1,666,000, or 15 cents a share for the latest year and $2,788,000, or 27 cents a share for 1988. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Farm & Home Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income The company said the latest quarter and 12 months losses reflect the impact of its Farm & Home Savings Associations subsidiary's addition to loan and real estate loss reserves.

title: Intercargo Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $91,000, or 4 cents a share.

title: Dinkins Seeking Advice on Ethics Of Cable Talks
description: Mayor David N. Dinkins has asked an ethics panel to advise him on participating in deliberations over cable television franchises because his son owns stock in a company with an interest in a franchise in Queens.

title: Castle (A.M.) & Co.  (A) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Morden & Helwig reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results are in Canadian funds.

title: Film Makers Protest to Academy
description: The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences will consider charges by some prominent film makers that a conflict of interest could have affected the choice of nominees in this year's documentary film category. Bruce Davis, the academy's executive director, said ''the issue will get a hearing'' at the academy's next board meeting in April in Los Angeles.

title: With Peace Talks Near, Cambodia Reports Victory
description: With a new round of peace talks starting here on Monday, the Cambodian Government has achieved its first victory in a counteroffensive against opposition forces in northwestern Cambodia.

title: Suspect in Slaying On S.I. Is Returned
description: The second suspect in the death of a man who was fatally stabbed because his attackers believed he was homosexual waived extradition and was returned from Florida yesterday, the police said.

title: Consoltex Canada Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a write-off of $1,706,000 for both the quarter and year. c-Included tax credits of $193,000, or 7 cents a share for the quarter and $465,000, or 16 cents a share for the year. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Illness Stops Agassi in Midmatch
description: And then there were none.

title: Bally Manufacturing Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a net gain of $33.9 million on sale of a subsidiary, partially offset by a net charge of $8.4 million related to restructuring costs. c-Included a net gain of $5.1 million from sale of securities. The latest full year net also was after an extraordinary charge of $8,411,000 for early retirement of debt.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article on the Consumer's World page last Saturday about two new cameras that reduce ''red eye'' in photographs misidentified a camera maker and its parent company. The Olympus Infinity Zoom 200 is made by the Olympus Corporation, which is owned by the Olympus Optical Company of Tokyo.

title: Television Networks Reported Ready to Form Group to Poll Voters
description: The three major television networks and Cable News Network have agreed to create a single Election Day poll of voters after they have voted that would provide the same information at the same time to each organization, two senior network officials who asked not to be identified said yesterday.

title: Edisto Resources Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included $22 million non-cash charge to earnings attributable to the April 1989 property sale for the year ended Dec. 31. c-Net income The company said certain items have been reclassified and financial statements for both years have been restated.

title: Yes, It's So, Joe
description: My little boy Joe had tears in his eyes when he heard baseball's spring training camps wouldn't open on schedule. ''Say it ain't so, Dad,'' he sobbed. ''What kind of people would ruin spring for all Americans?''

title: Johnny Couldn't Read in 1905
description: LEAD: The failures of black and Hispanic schoolchildren are of great concern to today's educators. They rarely note, however, that white children of European origin were failing in our schools long before blacks and Hispanics were.

title: Code-Alarm Inc. reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
RESULTS PLUS
description: COLLEGE BASKETBALL

title: Stepan Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Corrections
description: A review in Weekend yesterday about the show ''Graphic Design in America: A Visual Language History'' misidentified a film for which Saul Bass designed opening credits. It was ''The Man With the Golden Arm.'' (The credits for ''Goldfinger'' were designed by Robert Brownjohn.)

title: What Mr. Reagan Remembers
description: Nobody expected Ronald Reagan to shed much new light on the Iran-contra affair. But the former President's recorded testimony was even more vague and dismaying than anticipated. Yet he survived with the same mixture of affability and innocence that saw him through the gravest blunders of his incumbency.

title: Fitzwater v. Lawyers
description: Anyone who disapproves of lawyers has a friend in the White House press secretary, Marlin Fitzwater, who said today, ''Lawyers certainly deserve all the criticism they can get.''

title: Jose Napoleon Duarte, Salvadoran Leader In Decade of War and Anguish, Dies at 64
description: Jose Napoleon Duarte, the former President of El Salvador who oversaw a shaky experiment in centrist civilian government after nearly a century of military rule, died yesterday at his home in San Salvador, his doctor said. He was 64 years old and had been diagnosed in May 1988 as having advanced liver cancer.

title: Restitution Ordered In Charity Fraud
description: A New York State judge has ordered the return of $58,527 in charitable contributions illegally collected by the Pacific West Coast Cancer Fund. Most of the money was raised in 1988 in $5 to $25 contributions from 10,000 New York residents who will get their money returned - if they can be located, the State Attorney General's office said yesterday.

title: CHRONICLE
description: A Federal jury has rejected a $25 million claim that STEVIE WONDER'S song ''I Just Called to Say I Love You'' was plagiarized from the work of another songwriter. LLOYD CHIATE, the plaintiff, claimed that Mr. Wonder's song was stolen from his own song ''I Just Called to Say,'' which he wrote with LEE GARRETT.

title: David White Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income and included an extraordinary charge from a reversal of tax-loss carryforwards of $36,000 for the quarter and an extraordinary tax credit of $54,000 for the year.

title: Books of The Times;   Galbraith the Novelist In Economic Fairy Tale
description: A Tenured Professor

title: N.F.L. Drug Adviser Asks to Be Replaced
description: The National Football League announced yesterday that its embattled drug adviser, Dr. Forest Tennant, had asked to be replaced by April 1.

title: Upheaval in the East: Soviet Union;   Russian 'Patriots' Scorn Gorbachev and the Left
description: The devout of the Russian hard-liners gathered in a sports arena here tonight to condemn President Mikhail S. Gorbachev for his attempts to liberalize and Westernize Soviet society, and to celebrate being Russian nationalists when many consider such attitudes chauvinist.

title: Talking Troops and Dollars in Korea
description: Korea's militarized North-South frontier remains dangerous even at the end of the cold war that prompted it. Pyongyang is still armed to the teeth, rigid and unpredictable. What has changed is the ability of South Korea, after years of stunning growth, to help pay for its own defense.

title: F.C.C. Urged to Act on Syndication
description: Senator Daniel K. Inouye, the chairman of the Senate subcommittee on communications, is urging the Federal Communications Commission to ''assert its jurisdiction'' over the rules that have prevented the three broadcast networks from having a financial interest in the programs they broadcast.

title: Dow Off Amid Worries About Rates and Tokyo
description: Stock prices retreated again yesterday, pulled down by worries about interest rates and another exceptionally steep decline in the Tokyo stock market.

title: Nets Can't Manage to Grab a Victory
description: During one sequence in the third quarter tonight, Dennis Hopson threw an errant pass that hit his coach, Bill Fitch, in the back. Fitch closed his eyes in disgust, and when he opened them again, his view didn't get any better.

title: Statements Are Allowed In Jogger Case
description: In what is regarded as a pivotal victory for the prosecution, a judge ruled yesterday that incriminating statements by five of the six defendants in the Central Park rape case could be admitted as evidence.

title: Utility Escapes Fine in Handling of A-Plant Waste
description: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission said yesterday that it would cite the Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation, but not fine it, for the mishandling of radioactive waste at its Nine Mile Point 1 nuclear plant.

title: Bank Robberies Soaring Again, Baffling Bankers and the F.B.I.
description: Bank robberies in New York City have risen sharply in the last few months, and the suddenness and sharpness of the increase has bank executives and law enforcement officials baffled.

title: Habib Sabet Is Dead; An Iranian Altruist And Industrialist, 86
description: Habib Sabet, one of Iran's major industrialists, died of congestive heart failure on Tuesday at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles. He was 86 years old and lived in Paris.

title: Pakistan Open to U.S. Plan on Afghans, Aide Says
description: Pakistan has abandoned its support for a military solution in Afghanistan and has told the Bush Administration that it is not opposed to an American proposal that the Afghan President, Najibullah, remain in power during negotiations for a political settlement, a senior Pakistani official says.

title: Transactions
description: Baseball

title: 'Miss Margarida' Closing
description: ''Miss Margarida's Way,'' a revival of the 1977 one-woman play starring Estelle Parsons, will close after the matinee on Sunday at the Helen Hayes Theater, 240 West 44th Street. The show, written and directed by Roberto Athayde, will have run for 11 regular performances and 8 previews.

title: Cohu Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Arafat, Yielding, Now Backs Palestinian-Israeli Dialogue
description: An international peace conference meeting here received a letter today from Yasir Arafat, head of the Palestine Liberation Organization, in which he gave Palestinians permission to enter peace negotiations with Israel, the first time that Mr. Arafat has extended such permission.

title: Pittsburgh Urged to Revive Mills To Turn Out High-Speed Trains
description: Carnegie Mellon University proposed today that Pittsburgh become the nation's center for manufacturing high-speed railroad lines that are being considered by many states.

title: Religion Notes
description: Plea on Soviet Clash The clash between Christian Armenians and Muslim Azerbaijanis in the Soviet Union has provoked an unusual joint statement from representatives of the Armenian and Muslim communities in Los Angeles. Religious leaders from the two groups warned in early February against interpreting the Soviet conflict as one ''based on religious differences.''

title: Ramsay Health Care reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After extraordinary credits of $228,000, or 2 cents a share, for the quarter and $484,000, or 3 cents a share, for the 6 months, both from reduction in federal and state income taxes arising from net operating loss carryforwards. c-Net loss and after similar extraordinary credits of $261,000, or 2 cents a share, for the quarter and $372,000, or 2 cents a share, for the 6 months. Share earnings are fully diluted.

title: 92d Street Y to Present Two Evenings of Poetry
description: A two-part poetry series featuring works by new poets is to begin on March 6 at 8:15 P.M. at the 92d Street Y, at Lexington Avenue. Three poets - Thomas Bolt, Peter Sacks and Elizabeth Spires - are to read from their works at the first part of the series, entitled ''The Tenth Muse.'' Anthony Hecht, winner of the 1968 Pulitzer Prize for poetry, will introduce the program.

title: Penny-Stock Fraud Charges
description: Meyer Blinder, a founder of a large penny-stock brokerage, and four associates were indicted today in Las Vegas on Federal racketeering and securities fraud charges.

title: C3 Inc. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included $4,600,000 in interest expense and a $3,300,000 pretax charge to reflect the obsolesence of certain hardware, software, and spare parts inventories. c-Net income C3 was acquired by Knoll Capital Management last May.

title: The Gamble on Reagan Testimony Offers Former Security Adviser Some Small Comfort, but Greater Danger
description: Ronald Reagan's videotaped testimony endangers a central defense contention in the upcoming trial of John M. Poindexter that the former President authorized Mr. Poindexter's actions in the Iran-contra affair, several criminal lawyers said today.

title: Lyondell Petrochemical reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: There were no share earnings for the year-ago quarter and year because the company went public in January 1989.

title: Man in Police-Bias Case May Get Troopers' Files
description: A Superior Court judge ruled today that a motorist has a right to seek state police investigative reports if he can show that they will support his contention that his arrest on the New Jersey Turnpike in 1988 was racially motivated.

title: Benihana National Corp. reports earnings for 12wks to Dec 31
description: b-Included a gain of $378,052 from disposition of a restaurant for both the 12 weeks and 40 weeks.

title: Xiox Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: California Saving Unit Is Seized
description: In the most striking indication yet of how the woes of the ''junk bond'' market have spread to the savings and loan industry, the Government today seized the Imperial Savings and Loan Association, one of California's largest savings institutions.

title: Arkla Exploration reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
Upheaval in the East: The Germanys;   Bush to Press Kohl at Camp David On Easing Poland's Border Fears
description: When President Bush meets over the weekend with Chancellor Helmut Kohl, he will urge the West German leader to calm Polish concerns about the future of the Polish-German border, Administration officials said today.

title: Colleges Could Boost School Science Programs;   Art Is Neglected
description: To the Editor:

title: Tri-R Systems Corp. reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net loss

title: West Co. reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The 1988 periods reclassified for comparative purposes.

title: Germans Are Said to Weigh A Dual Rate on Currency
description: In an effort to balance political expediency and economic wisdom, the West German Government is considering using more than one exchange rate in a monetary union with East Germany, Government officials said today.

title: Reassurance by First Boston That It Is Financially Sound
